Christ Church Cathedral: No more taxpayer funding for rebuild https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/christ-church-cathedral-no-more-taxpayer-funding-for-rebuild/P7VCUMP7JBAFVOPLWCKVC25ONI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/christ-church-cathedral-no-more-taxpayer-funding-for-rebuild/P7VCUMP7JBAFVOPLWCKVC25ONI/ Government will not provide $60m of taxpayer cash to bail out troubled project. Fri, 09 Aug 2024 02:26:28 +0000 Finance Minister Nicola Willis has confirmed the Government will not step in with any further taxpayer funding for the Christ Church Cathedral rebuild. Photo / RNZ / Nate McKinnon
New Zealand, Australia launch joint humanitarian aid project for 14 Pacific nations https://www.nzherald.co.nz/talanoa/new-zealand-australia-launch-joint-人道主义-aid-project-for-14-pacific-nations/TXWNGNOCMFFFLBCVY2TG4AYKYM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/talanoa/new-zealand-australia-launch-joint-人道主义-aid-project-for-14-pacific-nations/TXWNGNOCMFFFLBCVY2TG4AYKYM/ Natasha Hill, Isaac GunsonWinston Peters says the initiative 'places Pacific countries at the centre of responses'. Fri, 09 Aug 2024 01:42:48 +0000 The Foreign Ministers of Aotearoa New Zealand and Australia, Winston Peters (pictured) and Penny Wong, have announced a joint humanitarian aid project to help Pacific nations take the lead on recovery efforts. Photo / Mark Mitchell
Somerville Intermediate School’s care for injured student requiring surgery ‘appalling’: Family https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/somerville-intermediate-schools-care-for-injured-student-requiring-surgery-appalling-family/YZP3GTIEQBHT7EZUO4RYSD7WRA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/somerville-intermediate-schools-care-for-injured-student-requiring-surgery-appalling-family/YZP3GTIEQBHT7EZUO4RYSD7WRA/ Ben LeahyThe schoolyard attack left an open wound on the boy's face, exposing muscle and tissue. Fri, 09 Aug 2024 01:40:38 +0000 A 12-year-old Somerville Intermediate School student has suffered a horrific gash to his cheek after an attack from a fellow student during school hours.
